summary: This is an FBI Public Affairs News Briefing from January 6, 2021, covering a wide range of national security, criminal, and political news. It includes updates on the SolarWinds hack attributed to Russia, the Capitol protests, and brief mentions of ongoing Epstein/Maxwell investigations, specifically noting the FBI traced Ghislaine Maxwell using cell phone data and that Attorney General William Barr questioned Jeffrey Epstein's cellmate.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned in a brief update that the FBI traced her using cell phone data and a fake mobile phone mast as part of the Jeffrey Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Deceased financier and accused sex trafficker
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to the investigation into his death and his cellmate being questioned by Attorney General William Barr.

persons.name: William Barr
persons.context: Mentioned as having personally questioned Jeffrey Epstein's last cellmate, Efrain 'Stone' Reyes.

persons.name: Efrain Reyes
persons.context: Identified as the last inmate to share a cell with Jeffrey Epstein before his suicide; was questioned by Attorney General William Barr.

persons.name: Christopher Wray
persons.context: Mentioned in a separate news item as being urged by Democratic lawmakers to investigate President Trump over a call to Georgia officials.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Frequently mentioned throughout the briefing in various contexts, including election challenges, protests, and policy actions. Not directly connected to Epstein/Maxwell in this document.

connections.description: Attorney General Barr personally questioned Reyes, the last cellmate of Jeffrey Epstein.
Maxwell is a central figure in the FBI's ongoing investigation related to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: FBI News Briefing Publication
events.description: Bulletin Intelligence publishes its daily FBI Public Affairs News Briefing, covering a wide array of law enforcement and national security topics.

events.title: FBI Traces Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: An affidavit indicates the FBI traced Ghislaine Maxwell's location using her cell phone data and a fake mobile phone mast.

events.title: Barr Questions Epstein's Cellmate
events.description: Attorney General William Barr personally questioned Efrain 'Stone' Reyes, the last inmate to share a cell with Jeffrey Epstein before his suicide.

keyFacts: The FBI traced Ghislaine Maxwell using her cell phone data and a fake mobile phone mast as part of the Jeffrey Epstein investigation.
Attorney General William Barr personally questioned Efrain 'Stone' Reyes, Jeffrey Epstein's last cellmate.
The document is a broad news briefing; the Epstein/Maxwell references are two brief items among many unrelated news stories.
The briefing date coincides with the January 6th Capitol protests, which are a major focus of the document.
The document shows the Epstein/Maxwell investigation remained an active topic in law enforcement and intelligence briefings as of early 2021.
